items.title: Reliance Infrastructure, Reliance Power shares rally over 10% in 2 days. Here’s what moved the Anil Ambani stocks
items.description: Reliance Infrastructure and Reliance Power shares surged over 10% in two days after project wins boosted sentiment. Reliance Infra bagged an NHPC solar-plus-BESS project, while Reliance Power entered a Bhutan JV, strengthening their clean energy pipeline to over 3 GW solar and 3.5 GWh storage.

items.title: Investors bet on September US rate cut, bigger easing urged
items.description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said revenues from President Trump’s sweeping tariffs will be significantly higher than his earlier estimate of $300 billion. He made it clear that the priority will be to use these funds to pay down the federal debt first, rather than distributing rebate checks to Americans. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Trump turns up heat on Powell ahead of Jackson hole
items.description: Donald Trump has renewed his attack on Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, accusing him of “hurting” the housing industry. Trump repeated his call for a big interest rate cut, arguing that inflation is not a concern and that the economy is signaling the need for major easing. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: As IRFC shares sink 50% from peak, why scaling crucial resistance could be a tall order?
items.description: IRFC shares have significantly declined, falling 50% from their peak despite a double-digit increase in Q1 net profit. Technical analysis indicates a weak setup, with the stock struggling below the critical Rs 130 resistance level. Experts suggest reclaiming this level will be challenging, reflecting a broader downturn in railway stocks.

items.title: Canva begins employee stock sale at $42 billion valuation, Bloomberg News reports
items.description: Canva has launched an employee stock sale at a $42 billion valuation, according to Bloomberg.

items.title: Intel’s $24 billion rally sends valuation to dot-com levels
items.description: Intel's stock has surged recently due to potential government equity and SoftBank investment, reaching valuation levels not seen since the dot-com era. While optimism surrounds CEO Lip-Bu Tan's turnaround efforts, concerns linger about the company's long-term profitability and technological competitiveness. Analysts remain cautious, citing an overvalued stock and uncertain future prospects.

items.title: Vikram Solar, Mangal Electrical among 7 hot IPOs this week. Which one tops the GMP charts?
items.description: In this IPO-heavy week, 5 mainboard initial public offerings (IPOs) and two SME issues are on the anvil. While 4 mainboards opened on Tuesday, one opens today. In the SME segment, Studio LSD will close today while ARC Insulation & Insulators IPO will open on Thursday, August 21. Here is a sneak peek into their grey market premiums (GMPs) ahead of the opening and who is winning the race so far. GMP is the premium (or discount) at which an IPO’s shares are traded unofficially before their official listing on the stock exchange, they are dynamic and subject to change.

items.title: Mukesh Ambani wants to double RIL size by FY30. What it means for 44 lakh shareholders
items.description: Mukesh Ambani aims to double Reliance Industries by FY30, potentially re-rating the stock for 44 lakh shareholders. RIL shares have already surged this year. The upcoming AGM on August 29 is crucial for strategic announcements. Jio and Retail are expected to drive growth. New energy is a key pillar. Investment banks back this transformation. Investors await further details.

items.title: Aditya Infotech shares rise over 2% after 46% YoY surge in Q1 PAT
items.description: Aditya Infotech reported a strong set of numbers for Q1FY26, posting a 46% year-on-year jump in profit after tax (PAT) at Rs 32.88 crore, compared with Rs 22.51 crore in the year-ago quarter. Revenue from operations rose 16.3% YoY to Rs 740.03 crore from Rs 636.02 crore.

items.title: Ola Electric shares rally 18% in 2 days. Analysts say Rs 57 within reach; should you buy?
items.description: Ola Electric share price rebounded this week, rallying 18% after a significant slide. Investors are weighing potential GST reforms that could favor conventional cars against signs of renewed momentum for the EV maker. Despite weak financials, some analysts see bottom formation, with technical indicators suggesting a possible further recovery.

items.title: Sensex jumps over 100 pts, Nifty tops 25,000 ; IT stocks rise
items.description: Indian markets initially declined due to HDFC Bank and State Bank of India's performance, mirroring a tech selloff on Wall Street. However, indices recovered, influenced by expectations of GST reforms and potential demand boosts in various sectors.

items.title: UltraTech Cement shares in focus as company set to hit 200 MTPA capacity ahead of schedule
items.description: UltraTech Cement shares are likely to be in focus after Chairman Kumar Mangalam Birla said the company will cross the 200 MTPA capacity milestone by the end of this fiscal, a year ahead of its FY27 target. With strong organic expansion and acquisitions, UltraTech is set to strengthen its leadership as India’s infrastructure growth accelerates.

items.title: Ramco Cements shares in focus as company sees revenue doubling in 4–5 years
items.description: Ramco Cements has set an ambitious target to double its revenue to ₹16,000 crore within the next 4–5 years, backed by a ₹2,000 crore push from its new construction chemicals brand and expansion of cement production capacity to 30 MTPA by mid-2026. The company will invest ₹1,000 crore in this capacity addition, CEO A V Dharmakrishnan said.

items.title: Nazara Tech, Delta Corp shares slide up to 7% as Cabinet clears online gaming regulation bill
items.description: Shares of Nazara Technologies and Delta Corp experienced a decline following the Union Cabinet's approval of a bill to regulate online gaming platforms. The legislation addresses mental health concerns, money laundering risks, and fraudulent transactions within the digital gaming industry. Investors are closely monitoring Nazara Technologies as the bill is expected to reshape the regulatory landscape for the sector.

items.title: IIFL Finance, Chennai Petroleum, Reliance Power among 7 stocks with White Marubozu Pattern
items.description: On August 19, 14 stocks from the Nifty 500 pack appeared in the bullish "White Marubozu" scanner, according to technical scan data from StockEdge.com. We have highlighted the top seven stocks from the list. A White Marubozu is a bullish candlestick pattern in technical analysis. It occurs when the opening price is the lowest for a given period, and the closing price is the highest.Represented by a long white (or green) candlestick with no upper shadow and a small or nonexistent lower shadow, it indicates strong buying pressure throughout the session. Traders interpret it as a signal that buyers were in control from the opening to the closing, often using such patterns for informed decisions about future price movements in financial markets.

items.title: Westlife Foodworld, Raymond among 7 stocks that rose above VWAP
items.description: On August 19, the closing prices of seven stocks in the Nifty500 pack rallied over 2% relative to their VWAP (Volume Weighted Average Price), and a shift above the VWAP suggests a potential bullish trend, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data.When the closing price rises above the VWAP, it signifies that the closing price is higher than the average price at which it was traded throughout the day, with the average being weighted by trading volume. This occurrence is often interpreted as a potential bullish signal by traders and investors. Potentially indicating positive sentiment in the market.

items.title: Citadel Securities expands team in India after Jane Street saga
items.description: Citadel Securities is expanding its Indian operations by hiring options trader Prajual Maheshwari, signaling confidence in the South Asian market despite recent regulatory scrutiny. The firm aims to recruit more traders and senior staff for its Gurugram office, which already handles cash equities and derivatives.

items.title: Balancing Risks and Rewards: Fed official calls for embracing crypto
items.description: Federal Reserve Vice Chair for Supervision Michelle Bowman suggested that central bank staff should be allowed to hold small amounts of crypto products. She argued that direct experience with digital assets would improve their ability to regulate the sector effectively. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Stocks to Buy | Autos, chemicals and fertilisers poised to benefit fromGST reforms
items.description: Alok Agarwal, in an interview with ET Now, said that the Nifty has touched the 25,000 mark, lifted by the government’s decision to rationalise GST rates. He explained that this move is being seen as a much-needed fiscal stimulus to boost consumption across the economy. According to him, with the RBI already taking steps on the monetary side and earlier reforms on direct taxes and regulations, the latest GST change provides the missing push on the fiscal front, creating a more balanced policy support for growth.

items.title: Regaal Resources shares slip 7% after strong D-Street debut
items.description: Regaal Resources shares: The stock debuted at ₹141.80 on the BSE, a 39% premium to its IPO price of ₹102, and at ₹141 on the NSE, marking a 38.2% gain. However, the initial surge lost steam as the shares slipped to an intraday low of ₹131.9 on the BSE.
